briefTitle: Vaginal Preparation With Chlorhexidine-alcohol vs. Povidine-iodine vs. Saline

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Intervention Group (vaginal preparation)

Inclusion Criteria:

* Pregnant women admitted for cesarean delivery
* Gestational age greater than or equal to 34 weeks

Exclusion Criteria:

* Rupture of membranes or active labor
* Chorioamnionitis (prior to enrollment)
* Recent (within 4 weeks) antibiotic exposure
* Maternal HIV infection or immunocompromised state
* Known allergy to shellfish, iodine, or chlorhexidine

outcomeMeasures.title: Post-intervention Aerobic Bacterial Colony Counts
outcomeMeasures.description: Vaginal cultures are collected after the vaginal preparation intervention. These undergo serial dilutions and are incubated on Tryptic Soy Agar for seven days. Bacteria colony counts were determined by blinded investigators on day 7.

outcomeMeasures.title: Post-intervention Anaerobic Bacterial Colony Counts
outcomeMeasures.description: Vaginal cultures are collected after the vaginal preparation intervention. These undergo serial dilutions and are incubated on Tryptic Soy Agar for seven days. Bacteria colony counts were determined by blinded investigators on day 7.

outcomeMeasures.title: Baseline Aerobic Bacterial Colony Counts
outcomeMeasures.description: Vaginal cultures are collected immediately prior to the vaginal preparation intervention. These undergo serial dilutions and are incubated on Tryptic Soy Agar for seven days. Bacteria colony counts were determined by blinded investigators on day 7.

outcomeMeasures.title: Baseline Anaerobic Bacterial Colony Counts
outcomeMeasures.description: Vaginal cultures are collected immediately prior to the vaginal preparation intervention. These undergo serial dilutions and are incubated on Tryptic Soy Agar for seven days. Bacteria colony counts were determined by blinded investigators on day 7.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Diagnosed With Postpartum Infections.
outcomeMeasures.description: Chart review to assess any maternal infections diagnosed during postpartum hospitalization or at the time of the postpartum visit.
